articles.title: Appeal to Progressives around World
articles.content:
Appeal to Progressives around World
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea released an appeal to the world progressive people loving peace and aspiring after independence and justice on March 8.
					 In the appeal the committee decided to intensify international solidarity movement during the June-October, 2015 "solidarity period for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea" that was set in December last year on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the 35th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					
					 The appeal underscored the need to intensify the international movement for supporting the most reasonable and just proposals for realizing the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and extend solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defuse the danger of war, ease tension and create a peaceful environment on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It also stressed the need to conduct mass campaign demanding a stop to the annual large-scale joint military exercises staged by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities, create an atmosphere of rejecting all sanctions and "human rights" racket violating the sovereignty of the DPRK and conduct a solicitation movement to let the UN and governments of all countries demand the improvement of the DPRK-U.S. relations.
					
					 It also underlined the need to conduct the activities demanding the implementation of the north-south joint declarations by various forms and methods, organize the movement for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and turn it into the worldwide movement involving broad masses.
					
					 It called for forming more committees for supporting the reunification of Korea in different parts of the world and expanding those organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in different countries into more powerful and influential bodies.
					
					 It voiced the conviction that the world progressive people would extend full support and solidarity to the cause for Korea's reunification for the sake of the building of a free and prosperous, new world and the eternal happiness of humankind.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russian University
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russian University
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and other Korean books and picture album introducing the DPRK were conveyed to the State Humanities University in the Far East, Russia on March 10. 
					 The vice-minister of Education and Science of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration said the ceremony of donating books marked an important occasion in developing the relations between Russia and the DPRK. 
					
					 The Khabarovsk Territory Administration will as ever make positive efforts to develop education and science cooperation with the DPRK, he added. 
					
					 The president of the university said the books will greatly contribute to helping the teachers and students of the university be better aware of the DPRK. 
					
					 It is the common task for the peoples of the two countries to boost the Russia-DPRK friendly relations with the long history and tradition, he said, expressing the will to activate academic researches and knowledge dissemination about the DPRK, a close friend of Russia, based on these books.

articles.title: Pyongyang Disabled Persons Perform in Britain, France
articles.content:
Pyongyang Disabled Persons Perform in Britain, France
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang exchange group of disabled persons gave performances in Britain and France from Feb. 20 to Mar. 2.
					 Put on the stage were Korean art pieces like "Song of Sea", "Pyongyang Nalpharam", "Arirang" and "Dance of Fans", foreign art pieces and world famous music.
					
					 The performers vividly portrayed through instrumental music, songs and dances how they bring into full bloom their artistic talents under the policy of socialist Korea on looking after the disabled.
					
					 The audience was deeply impressed to see those with visual and hearing impediment and the physically crippled  people singing and dancing while playing accordion and kayagum as good as professionals.
					
					 After the performances the audience gave bouquets to the performers and congratulated them on their successful performances while having photos taken and talking with the disabled.
					
					 A professor of Oxford University said that it is something beyond imagination that those with hearing trouble perform group dancing.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and chairman of the Korean Friendship Association UK, said the disabled people in the DPRK lead an independent and creative life with the hope for the future just like other ordinary people.
					
					 Benoit Quennedey, vice-president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said the performances served as an important occasion in making the hostile forces' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket end in failure.
					
					 The audience said they were so impressed, the performances were incredible and the level of education of the disabled is so high, adding the performances helped them come to clearly know about the reality in the DPRK.

articles.title: Preemptive Attack Is Not Monopoly of U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Preemptive Attack Is Not Monopoly of U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The on-going U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are typical offensive drills and a test nuclear war aimed to mount a surprise and preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK from A to Z, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 The main purpose of those exercises are to enhance the combined and joint operational capabilities of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces and the south Korean puppet army and finally round off the overall war preparation, pursuant to the scenario for preemptive attack on the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 This year's saber-rattling is aimed to acquire the capabilities for preemptive nuclear strike at strategic depth and important bases of the DPRK.
					
					 As it has been clear that the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces made it a fait accompli to unleash a nuclear war and are putting spurs to it, the DPRK cannot remain a passive onlooker to it.
					
					 The servicepersons and people of the DPRK are sharply watching the saber-rattling by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet military gangsters with the greatest vigilance. 
					
					 The powerful Paektusan revolutionary army keeps within their sight not only all forces involved in the drills but military bases in south Korea and other parts of the world, White House, Chongwadae and other bases for aggression and provocation. 
					
					 If the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces drop a bomb over the inviolable waters, air and territory of the DPRK, it will wipe them out with merciless blow. 
					
					 Preemptive attack is not a monopoly of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 The DPRK will mount merciless just strike at objects it needs at the necessary time, unrestrained, without any warning and advance notice. This last warning is not hot air.

articles.title: S. Koreans Oppose Retrogressive Revision of Pension System
articles.content:
S. Koreans Oppose Retrogressive Revision of Pension System
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- More than 300 south Korean trade unions and civic and social organizations of south Korea, including the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Solidarity for Progress, the Federation of Women's Organizations, the Solidarity for Abolition of Discrimination against Disabled Persons and the Teachers Union, formed a People's Action for Increasing Public Pension in Seoul. 
					 A press conference for the inauguration of the action was held in Seoul on March 11.
					
					 Speeches were made by the chief vice-chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions, the permanent vice-chairman of the Federation of Trade Unions, the secretary general of the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the secretary general of the Federation of Women's Organizations, the permanent co-representative of the Solidarity for Abolition of Discrimination against Disabled Persons and the chairman of the Government Employees' Union.
					
					 They said that the Park Geun Hye regime was not following through on the "commitment" to ensuring basic pension. 
					
					 They noted that the regime cut down the pension for the government employees but it would retrogressively revise the pension for the ordinary people later.
					
					 They said they would fight against the authorities' revision of pension in order to save the women from poverty and provide a stable life to the popular masses.
					
					 The participants called upon the civic and social organizations to take part in the solidarity struggle to check the authorities' revision moves.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand Stop to Missile Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand Stop to Missile Deployment
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Civic organizations of south Korea including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Solidarity for Progress held a press conference outside the building of the "Saenuri Party" on March 11 where they denounced the moves for the deployment of THAAD in south Korea, part of the moves for intensifying the U.S.-south Korea military alliance.
					 The organizations in a press release accused the "Saenuri Party" of taking the lead in the deployment of THAAD in south Korea under the pretext of tightening military alliance with the U.S. as occasioned by an attack on the U.S. ambassador.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party's" attempted deployment of THAAD is an act of hurting the nation, the press release said.
					
					 It demanded the "Saenuri Party" not abuse the recent attack on the U.S. ambassador for tightening the military alliance and immediately stop the attempted deployment of THAAD that threatens peace on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Japanese Regional Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration Meets
articles.content:
Japanese Regional Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration Meets
Tokyo, March 14 (KNS-KCNA) -- The 7th general meeting of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration was held in Tokyo on March 11. 
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), So Chung On, director of the Department for International Affairs and Reunification of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Japanese Regional Committee, and other members of the committee and Japanese figures.
					
					 Son Hyong Gun in a report referred to the successes made by the committee in the struggle for accomplishing the great national unity and developing the national reunification movement into the nationwide movement.
					
					 Nam Sung U called upon all overseas Koreans to decorate June 15 and August 15 as great festivals common to the nation.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 A special statement was adopted under the title of "We resolutely denounce the joint military exercises frustrating the north-south relations and bringing the disaster of a nuclear war to the Korean peninsula".
					
					 The statement said that frantic Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises are not "annual defensive" but provocative and dangerous war exercises for aggression aimed to make a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 It said that the above-said committee would achieve solidarity with all the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad and more dynamically wage the movement for peace against war to foil the war moves of the separatists at home and abroad.
					
					 It said the committee would conduct together with all the Koreans in Japan and broad Japanese citizens diverse activities to remove the cause of war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The statement concluded that the committee would dynamically advance towards a broad avenue to independent reunification.

articles.title: Masikryong Ski Resort Introduced by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Masikryong Ski Resort Introduced by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- An article titled "Masikryong Ski Resort" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on March 10.
					 Saying that the world-class ski resort built on Masik Pass in Korea that had not been known well, is drawing the great attention of the international community, the article introduced in detail how it was peculiarly built on the highest level.
					
					 The article stressed that the ski resort will be more wonderful in the future, adding that the visitors to the resort is on the increase.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan on March 10.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events to praise the sacred revolutionary career and undying feats of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (his birth anniversary).

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Egypt
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on March 10.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt who doubles as chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events to praise the sacred revolutionary career and exploits of the President from March 15 to April 16.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A Bangladeshi preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on March 11 at the joint initiative of the Bangladesh Communist Party, the Bangladesh People's League and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee.
					 MD. Harun-Ar-Rashid, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a meeting, seminar, film show and other colorful political and cultural events of progressive political parties, social organizations, organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and Juche idea study organizations to highly praise the sacred revolutionary life and immortal exploits of the President.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Flailed by Russian Figure
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Flailed by Russian Figure
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Zhevin, chief of the Korean Affairs Study Center of the Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Sciences, had an interview with a journalist of the Sputnik News in connection with the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces' joint military exercises, according to Voice of Russia on March 5.
					 He referred to the fact that a drill of services of the Korean People's Army for hitting enemy naval target was staged at the personal initiative of KPA Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The DPRK is now on a high alert against the possible provocation by the naval force of the U.S. which it puts to use whenever it schemes to bring down governments of other countries.
					
					 This is the demonstration of the DPRK's firm will to resolutely cope with any attempt to invade its territory.
					
					 The south Korean media is now reporting that the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises are not "defensive". In other words, it is asserting that they are very offensive. What is worse is that it is not concealing that the exercises are aimed at striking the DPRK.
					
					 So I think that the DPRK has the legal right to bolster up the defence capabilities of the country.
					
					 He also referred to the fact that the U.S. and south Korea remain just as same as in the Cold War when they threatened the DPRK with Team Spirit joint military exercises.
					
					 He said that the U.S. is stifling the DPRK in all domains including politics and military affairs and even imposing sanctions against it.
					
					 He stressed that the U.S. and south Korea are trying to bring down the headquarters of the DPRK while making a fuss about its "human rights" in the international arena but that is nothing but a daydream of the politicians of the U.S. and south Korea and these acts are pushing the DPRK-U.S. relations and the north-south relations to deadlocks.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's historic concluding speech delivered at the March 2013 plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on March 10. 
					 The concluding speech made by him on March 31, Juche 102 (2013) clarifies the idea of holding fast to the line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force to bring about a decisive turn in building an economic power.
